Package camzup.core

Class Quadtree

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.Quadtree
public class Quadtree extends Object
Partitions space to improve collision and intersection tests. A quadtree node holds a list of points up to a given capacity; when that capacity is exceeded, the node is split into four children nodes (quadrants) and its list of points is emptied into them. The quadrants are indexed in an array as follows 
 |----|----|
 |  2 |  3 |
 | NW | NE |
 |----|----|
 |  0 |  1 |
 | SW | SE |
 |----|----|
forming a backwards z pattern.

  • Method Details

    • countLeaves

      public int countLeaves()
      Counts the number of leaves held by this quadtree. Returns 1 if this node is itself a leaf.
      Returns:
      the sum

    • countPoints

      public int countPoints()
      Counts the number of points held by this quadtree's leaf nodes.
      Returns:
      the sum

    • cull

      public boolean cull()
      Sets empty child nodes in the quadtree to null. Returns true if this quadtree node should be culled; i.e., all its children are null and it contains no points.
      Returns:
      the evaluation

    • getBounds

      public Bounds2 getBounds(Bounds2 target)
      Gets the quadtree bounds.
      Parameters:
      target - the output bounds
      Returns:
      the bounds

    • getCapacity

      public int getCapacity()
      Gets the capacity of the node.
      Returns:
      the capacity

    • getLeaves

      public Quadtree[] getLeaves()
      Gets the leaf nodes of a quadtree as a flat array. The nodes are passed by reference, not by value.
      Returns:
      the quadtree array
      See Also:
      • getLeaves(ArrayList)

    • getLevel

      public int getLevel()
      Gets the level, or depth, of the node.
      Returns:
      the level

    • getMaxLevel

      public int getMaxLevel()
      Gets the maximum level, or depth, of the node and its children.
      Returns:
      the level

    • getPoints

      public Vec2[] getPoints()
      Gets an array of points contained in this quadtree and its children. The points are transferred to the array by value, not reference, so changing them in the array will not change them within the tree.
      Returns:
      the points array
      See Also:
      • getPoints(ArrayList)

    • insert

      public boolean insert(Vec2 point)
      Inserts a point into the quadtree by reference. Returns true if the point was successfully inserted into the quadtree directly or indirectly through one of its children; returns false if the insertion was unsuccessful.
      Parameters:
      point - the point
      Returns:
      the insertion success
      See Also:
      • Bounds2.contains(Bounds2, Vec2)

    • insertAll

      public boolean insertAll(Vec2[] pts)
      Inserts points into the quadtree. Returns true if all insertions were successful; false if at least one was unsuccessful.
      Parameters:
      pts - the points
      Returns:
      the insertion success

    • isLeaf

      public boolean isLeaf()
      Evaluates whether this quadtree node has any children. Returns true if no; otherwise false.
      Returns:
      the evaluation

    • merge

      public Quadtree merge()
      If this quadtree node has children, converts it to a leaf node containing the centers of its children. Increases node capacity if necessary.
      Returns:
      this quadtree

    • reset

      public Quadtree reset()
      Resets this tree to an initial state, where its has no children and no points. Leaves the tree's bounds unchanged.
      Returns:
      this quadtree

    • reset

      public Quadtree reset(Bounds2 b)
      Resets this tree to an initial state, where its has no children and no points. Sets the bounds to the one supplied.
      Parameters:
      b - bounds
      Returns:
      this quadtree

    • setCapacity

      public void setCapacity(int capacity)
      Sets the capacity of the node. If the node's point size exceeds the new capacity, the node is split.
      Parameters:
      capacity - the new capacity
      See Also:
      • split(int)

      Subdivides this quadtree.

      Subdivides this quadtree.
      Parameters:
      iterations - iteration count
      Returns:
      this quadtree

    • subdivide

      public Quadtree subdivide(int iterations, int childCapacity)
      Subdivides this quadtree. For cases where a minimum number of children nodes is desired, independent of point insertion. The result will be 4 raised to the power of iterations, e.g., 4, 16, 64, 256.
      Parameters:
      iterations - iteration count
      childCapacity - child capacity
      Returns:
      this quadtree
      See Also:
      • split(int)

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the centers

    • centersMean

      public static Vec2[] centersMean(Quadtree q, boolean includeEmpty)
      Finds the average center in each leaf node of this quadtree. If the node is empty, and includeEmpty is true, then the center of the cell bounds is used instead.
      Parameters:
      q - the quadtree
      includeEmpty - include empty cells
      Returns:
      the centers

    • query

      public static Vec2[] query(Quadtree q, Bounds2 range)
      Queries the quadtree with a rectangular range, returning points inside the range.
      Parameters:
      q - the quadtree
      range - the range
      Returns:
      the points
      See Also:
      • Bounds2.center(Bounds2, Vec2)

      Parameters:

      radius - the circle radius
